message: The STAT_CONC_DEF field for indicator 2-2-1, translated into en
data: Acute malnutrition is a form of undernutrition. It is caused by a decrease in food intake and / or associated disease causing bilateral edema and / or sudden weight loss. Its severe form is characterized by the presence of bilateral edema or emaciation (low weight-for-height z-score or low MUAC). We distinguish the Global Acute Malnutrition (MAG) which is the sum of Moderate Acute Malnutrition (MAM) and Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM).
